Company

The manufacture of wind energy plants in the on-shore segment has been our core competence and passion for around 35 years. With more than 28 GW installed capacity worldwide, our turbines supply sustainable energy to more than 80% of the global energy market and we are one of the largest companies in the wind industry. National subsidiaries in more than 25 markets and production facilities in Germany, Spain, Brazil, the USA, Mexico and India offer our more than 6,500 employees the opportunity for international and intercultural cooperation. We are growing and together driving forward the expansion of alternative energies worldwide - if you wish, from now on with you.

If you are passionate of renewables energies, you love working in teams and you share our values of Integrity, Colleagueship, Respect and Ownership we would like you to join the Nordex Group.

Job description

Are you looking for fresh winds in your life? Are you ready to reach new heights in your career?

Nordex Sweden is now looking for a Field Support Technician with focus area SCADA this role will invole travelling, and you will 

FIRSTNAME LASTNAME Support Technician with Focus area SCADA and Park IT is a position usually based close too or inside the wind farms of the Service Areas in UK&Ireland and Nordics. The purpose of this position is to deliver on site/remote technical support as well as implementing SCADA and Park IT related solutions for the local field operations in UK&Ireland and Nordic Regions. In order to increase data availability and ensure connectivity of the wind frams it will be necessary to troubleshoot IT equipment on site or remotely in various wind farms as well as analyzing data and other information to be able to create and support the implementation of action plans that will increase data availability in the fleet. These include but are not limited to: performance analysis, on site actin plan implementation, analyzing data, analyzing reports, close cooperation with Technicians and Back Office staff, performing on the job demonstrations, on site improvements at problem equipment, on site software and hardware updates, online and over phone technical support, creating reports on turbine or turbine components as well as parameter changes and alarm change handling when necessary.

Job requirements

 Education and Qualifications: 

	Wind turbine technician Course
	​Preferable to have Electrical and IT qualification
	Computer and software handling
	Preferable to have Database handling qualification
	Computer literate strong on SAP and Microsoft products

Experience:

	Must be Health and Safety aware
	Must have Experience in wind Industry technician role
	Must have experience in planning and executing projects from start to finish
	Must have experience in troubleshooting on wind turbines
	Must have experience in troubleshooting of SCADA and other Park IT related equipment
	Must have NC2 update experience
	Ideally have experience with SQL databases
	Ideally have experience with SharePoint
	Ideally have experience giving technical support and instruction on site as well as by phone

 

Skills/Personal Profile:

	Able to work at heights
	Systematic problem solving behavior
	Good technical skills
	Good practical troubleshooting skills
	Hands on practical work experience
	Good Analytical skills
	Good communication skills and willing to be available for on-site and phone support
	Good planning and organizational skills
	Willing to travel regularly, including nights away from home.
	Can work well in a team or autonomously

 

For further info on the role please feel free to contact us.
